Description: A string composed of a number of large spherical beads and ellipsoids and one lenticular bead, all of cornelian. The latter is a flattened oval in shape and is chipped at one edge.
Curator's comments: For ellipsoids, cf. T. E. Peet & W. L S. Loat, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part III. 1912-13 (London, 1913), pl.VIII, group 8: Middle Kingdom. For lenticular beads, cf. Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl.XLVI, 2C: Middle Kingdom.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (499)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1983 Aug-Oct, Stratford, Passmore Edwards Museum, Life & Death in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
